unnormalised: ## Flash Sales: Blink and You Miss Out! (But Should You Even Care?)
normalised: ## Flash Sales: Blink and You Miss Out! (But Should You Even Care?)

unnormalised: Hey everyone, Raj here, diving into the world of flash sales! We've all seen them pop up, right? Sites like Myntra, Ajio, even your neighborhood Kirana store sometimes announces a "Crazy Sunday Sale!" for a few hours. They promise insane discounts – "Up to 70% off!" – and create this feeling of urgent FOMO (fear of missing out). But are they actually worth the hype, or just a clever marketing trick?

unnormalised: Think about it. You're scrolling through Instagram, and BAM! A flash sale ad hits you. "Limited time offer! Only till 6 PM!" suddenly you NEED that new kurta you were mildly considering. It's the same psychological principle behind why that plate of delicious biryani at your cousin Priya's wedding tastes so much better – scarcity makes it seem more valuable.

unnormalised: Businesses use flash sales for a bunch of reasons. Maybe they need to clear out old inventory before the Onam rush, or they're trying to boost sales during a typically slow week. They might be using it to attract new customers, hoping that the amazing deal will turn them into loyal shoppers.

unnormalised: I once bought a "branded" watch during a flash sale advertised at Rs. 999, only to find the exact same watch available on another site for Rs. 1200 with a much better warranty! Lesson learned.
normalised: I once bought a "branded" watch during a flash sale advertised at rupee nine hundred and ninety nine, only to find the exact same watch available on another site for rupee one thousand two hundred with a much better warranty! Lesson learned.

unnormalised: Flash sales can be a great way to snag a bargain, especially if you've been eyeing something for a while. But always do your research and avoid letting that "limited time offer" pressure you into buying something you'll regret later. Happy shopping (and may your internet connection be strong when the sale starts!)
